1.text: And David sang this song to the LORD on the day the LORD had delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.

2.text: He said: “The LORD is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer.

3.text: My God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield, and the horn of my salvation. My stronghold, my refuge, and my Savior, You save me from violence.

4.text: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised; so shall I be saved from my enemies.

5.text: For the waves of death engulfed me; the torrents of chaos overwhelmed me.

6.text: The cords of Sheol entangled me; the snares of death confronted me.

7.text: In my distress I called upon the LORD; I cried out to my God. And from His temple He heard my voice, and my cry for help reached His ears.

8.text: Then the earth shook and quaked; the foundations of the heavens trembled; they were shaken because He burned with anger.

9.text: Smoke rose from His nostrils, and consuming fire came from His mouth; glowing coals blazed forth.

10.text: He parted the heavens and came down with dark clouds beneath His feet.

11.text: He mounted a cherub and flew; He soared on the wings of the wind.

12.text: He made darkness a canopy around Him, a gathering of water and thick clouds.

13.text: From the brightness of His presence coals of fire blazed forth.

14.text: The LORD thundered from heaven; the voice of the Most High resounded.

15.text: He shot His arrows and scattered the foes; He hurled lightning and routed them.

16.text: The channels of the sea appeared, and the foundations of the world were exposed at the rebuke of the LORD, at the blast of the breath of His nostrils.

17.text: He reached down from on high and took hold of me; He drew me out of deep waters.

18.text: He rescued me from my powerful enemy, from foes too mighty for me.

19.text: They confronted me in my day of calamity, but the LORD was my support.

20.text: He brought me out into the open; He rescued me because He delighted in me.

21.text: The LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness; He has repaid me according to the cleanness of my hands.

22.text: For I have kept the ways of the LORD and have not wickedly departed from my God.

23.text: For all His ordinances are before me; I have not disregarded His statutes.

24.text: And I have been blameless before Him and kept myself from iniquity.

25.text: So the LORD has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to my cleanness in His sight.

26.text: To the faithful You show Yourself faithful, to the blameless You show Yourself blameless;

27.text: to the pure You show Yourself pure, but to the crooked You show Yourself shrewd.

28.text: You save an afflicted people, but Your eyes are on the haughty to bring them down.

29.text: For You, O LORD, are my lamp; the LORD lights up my darkness.

30.text: For in You I can charge an army; with my God I can scale a wall.

31.text: As for God, His way is perfect; the word of the LORD is flawless. He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.

32.text: For who is God besides the LORD? And who is the Rock except our God?

33.text: God is my strong fortress, and He makes my way clear.

34.text: He makes my feet like those of a deer and stations me upon the heights.

35.text: He trains my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

36.text: You have given me Your shield of salvation, and Your gentleness exalts me.

37.text: You broaden the path beneath me so that my ankles do not give way.

38.text: I pursued my enemies and destroyed them; I did not turn back until they were consumed.

39.text: I devoured and crushed them so they could not rise; they have fallen under my feet.

40.text: You have armed me with strength for battle; You have subdued my foes beneath me.

41.text: You have made my enemies retreat before me; I destroyed those who hated me.

42.text: They looked, but there was no one to save them—to the LORD, but He did not answer.

43.text: I ground them as the dust of the earth; I crushed and trampled them like mud in the streets.

44.text: You have delivered me from the strife of my people; You have preserved me as the head of nations; a people I had not known shall serve me.

45.text: Foreigners cower before me; when they hear me, they obey me.

46.text: Foreigners lose heart and come trembling from their strongholds.

47.text: The LORD lives, and blessed be my Rock! And may God, the Rock of my salvation, be exalted—

48.text: the God who avenges me and brings down nations beneath me,

49.text: who frees me from my enemies. You exalt me above my foes; You rescue me from violent men.

50.text: Therefore I will praise You, O LORD, among the nations; I will sing praises to Your name.

51.text: Great salvation He brings to His king. He shows loving devotion to His anointed, to David and his descendants forever.”
